meanings.definition: Of or relating to the running of a household.
meanings.sent1: She preferred to focus on domestics matters rather than outside concerns.
meanings.sent2: The family spent the weekend doing domestics chores like cleaning and organizing.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was in charge of domestics duties and tried to help with laundry.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of domestics responsibilities, each demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking filled the house, a comforting scent of domestics warmth.

meanings.sent1: She divided the domestics among the family members to share the workload.
meanings.sent2: Every Saturday, they tackled the domestics together to keep the house tidy.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum was a great help with the domestics, making cleaning easier.
meanings.sent4: The domestics seemed never-ending, but they brought a sense of accomplishment when completed.
meanings.sent5: The domestics list included laundry, dishes, and sweeping, all essential for a clean home.

meanings.definition: A person employed to manage household tasks.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy family hired a skilled domestics to take care of their estate.
meanings.sent2: The domestics was efficient in handling all the household responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to imitate the domestics by pretending to clean with a toy broom.
meanings.sent4: The domestics' dedication to their work was evident in the impeccable condition of the house.
meanings.sent5: The domestics greeted the family every morning with a smile, ready to assist with any task.
